item.title: Time manipulation action adventure game Retrace the Light launches November 20 for PC, later for PS5 and Xbox Series
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Explore the depths of human consciousness.

Time manipulation action adventure game Retrace the Light will launch for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on November 20 for $17.99, followed by PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series at a later date, publisher GlintForge and developer Xiaming Game announced. It will support English and Chinese voice-overs, and English, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese text.

“Retrace the Light is a beautiful game,” said Xiaming Game producer Guo Lei in a press release. “Underneath the fast-paced action and creative puzzles is an enthralling story of humanity’s future that we can all understand.”

Here is an overview of the game, via GlintForge:

In the year 3323, psychological issues like paranoia and obsessive thoughts can be cured from the inside-out thanks to mankind’s greatest invention: Primus, a supreme intelligence being. Observing the propensity of intense emotions to precede humanity’s irrational behaviors, the almighty AI begins to alter the mental states of those deemed “unstable” to create a safer, sanitized future.

Primus constructs Enforcer Decem, a warrior capable of diving into bizarre digital recreations of paranoid minds called Mirrormazes to destroy destructive thoughts. After a failed mission wipes Decem’s memories, set out to relearn the reason for his existence by retrieving memory fragments scattered across a futuristic utopia. Along the way, seek out the dark secrets behind the seemingly perfect world Decem was created to maintain.

Dash and slash through Mirrormares, mental anguish manifesting as mechanized foes. Decem leaves a temporary trail of light in his wake, and his Spatial Retrace ability stops time, empowering him to instantly teleport back to any point of the trail. Retrace to set up enemy-interrupting surprise attacks from unexpected angles, and solve mind-bending puzzles where the confines of time and space block the path forward.

Battle behemoth mechanical bosses with tactical thinking and keen spatial awareness, manipulating time and space to Decem’s will. Create a personalized fight style with seven Primary Combat Modules and twenty Secondary Modules for a custom combination of light and heavy strikes, charge attacks, counters, stances, and much more.

Encounter other Enforcers, learn about their missions, and explore a visually stunning world across crumbling ruins and bustling cities. Discover the forgotten past and determine humanity’s future in one of five multiple endings. Enjoy an immersive story with minimal enemy resistance, or fight the mind’s hardest battles with three different difficulties tailored for both action game veterans and newcomers.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/time-manipulation-action-adventure-game-retrace-the-light-launches-november-20-for-pc-later-for-ps5-and-xbox-series

item.title: Free-to-play battle royale Battlefield REDSEC announced
Brotato ‘New Dawn’ update now available for PC, coming to consoles and mobile in one month
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Smartphone
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

New items, new weapon, Ban system, and more.

Evil Empire has released its first update for Brotato since taking over the game’s post-launch development. Titled “New Dawn,” the update is available now for PC, with consoles and mobile versions to follow in approximately one month.

Here is an overview of the update, via Evil Empire:

The “New Dawn” update is the first new content update for Brotato since late 2024 and focuses on extensive quality of life changes—including an all-new ban system. Though, in true Evil Empire fashion, players will also find new items and a new weapon in there, too.

  • New Items – Leading the update are six new items which include Fresh Meat, Fruit Basket, Candy Bag, Ghost Outfit, Will-o’-Wisp and Hourglass—all of which provide various benefits to players skillsets and strengths while they take on wave after wave of gross little aliens.
  • New Weapon – Also joining the fray is a new weapon fans can wield if they so choose, the Vorpal Sword, which alternates between thrusting and sweeping attacks and grants players the ability to one-shot an enemy for the first time.
  • Ban System – Additional extras in today’s update includes the Ban system, a much-requested community feature that will allow players to ban up to eight items during a run. Win a run in Danger 3 or more to unlock the Ban system. Note: the Ban system does not include weapons.
  • New Saves – The New Dawn update also introduces three new save slots which gives players the option to copy progress onto another profile (or reset the save). Unlocking every item, character, weapon and Danger level on a save will deactivate the earning of achievements, so use with caution as you will still have to earn them the hard way.
  • Codex – The Codex introduces a new wiki-esque feature to the game, with information about Items, Weapons and Enemies (for example: How many times you killed a specific alien, etc.). Evil Empire plans to continue to build this feature out based on player feedback.

A longer and fully detailed list of updates can be found here.

Brotato is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC via Steam, iOS, and Android.

Watch a new trailer below.

“New Dawn” Update Developer Log



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/brotato-new-dawn-update-now-available-for-pc-coming-to-consoles-and-mobile-in-one-month

item.title: Horror adventure game Incantation coming to PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch in Q1 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Physical edition pre-orders open on October 30.

Publisher eastasiasoft and developer Softstar Entertainment will release horror adventure game Incantation for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch in Q1 2026, the companies announced.

Incantation first launched for PC via Steam on November 17, 2024.

eastasiasoft will also release physical editions of Incantation for PlayStation 5 and Switch. Pre-orders will open on October 30 at 8:00 a.m. PT / 11:00 a.m. ET via Play-Asia. The standard edition will be available for both platforms for $29.99. The limited edition will only be available for Switch for $39.99, and includes the game, manual, acrylic standees, Joy-Con stickers, mini case, a lucky charm, and a numbered certificate in a collector’s box.

Here is an overview of the game, via eastasiasoft:

About

Brave the darkness to find a lost loved one!

Immerse yourself in the chilling tale of the Chen Family Village, where a mother searching for her missing daughter accidentally stumbles into a haunted place filled with mysterious cults. Guide Jia Jun Lee as she searches a village and pieces together fragile clues to her loved one’s whereabouts, carefully hiding her movements as supernatural threats close in from all sides.

Incantation is a first-person horror-themed adventure game adapted from the live action film of the same name. Beyond the palpable madness and fear in the village, there’s a sinister force that drives one to despair. What happens when one crosses the forbidden line of this evil deity?

Perform rituals, solve puzzles, collect documents and hunt for key items to access new areas of the village, all in hopes of finding your missing daughter and escaping alive!

Key Features

  • Explore a village filled with dark family secrets and malicious spirits!
  • Search for clues to your missing daughter’s whereabouts while evading your pursuers.
  • Use hiding spots and perform rituals to protect yourself from supernatural threats!
  • Solve environmental puzzles and collect key items to gain access to new areas.
  • Enjoy an immersive cinematic experience inspired by Taiwanese culture and traditions!

Watch a new trailer below.

Switch Limited Edition Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/horror-adventure-game-incantation-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-and-switch-in-q1-2026
